            INFRASTRUCTURE DEVELOPMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Agriculture Infrastructure
            Development Project for Lebanon had the following ratings:
            the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability was likely,
            the institutional development impact was modest, and the
            Bank and borrower performance were both satisfactory. The
            lessons learned indicate that the project implementation by
            existing government agencies is feasible in Lebanon, and has
            the advantage of minimizing the need for transition
            arrangements at the end of the project provided that
            adequate resources and training are made available. Approval
            and financial procedures for project investments should be
            streamlined before project start-up. Training in Bank
            procurement and financial procedures is essential and it
            should take place at an early stage, especially for
            government agencies that have no prior exposure to the Bank.
            A solid Environment Unit is essential for the success of
            infrastructure development and it should be established at
            the beginning of the project. A strong monitoring and
            evaluation unit should be established from the beginning of
            the project, not only to look at the physical and financial
            aspects of the project, but also to follow-up on its impact
            and sustainability.
